DataElement.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Laparoscopy Total Mesorectal Excision Medical Device Therapy Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical device or instrument use to perform laparoscopic total mesorectal excision, creating a small incision through which laparoscopic instruments can be used to precisely remove of an intact mesorectal envelope with tumor-free margins.:The free text field related to therapy recommended

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Surgical Procedure Laparoscopy Total Mesorectal Excision Medical Device
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical device or instrument use to perform laparoscopic total mesorectal excision, creating a small incision through which laparoscopic instruments can be used to precisely remove of an intact mesorectal envelope with tumor-free margins.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredName: Laparoscopy Total Mesorectal Excision Medical Device
Property.preferredDefinition: (lap-a-RAHS-ko-pee) The insertion of a thin, lighted tube (called a laparoscope) through the abdominal wall to inspect the inside of the abdomen and remove tissue samples.:Surgery for rectal cancer involving precise removal of an intact mesorectal envelope with tumor-free margins.  Associated with local recurrence rates below 5% in clinical trials.  (from Medscape):Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.
Surgery for rectal cancer involving precise removal of an intact mesorectal envelope with tumor-free margins.  Associated with local recurrence rates below 5% in clinical trials.  (from Medscape)
Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field related to therapy recommended

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.
